Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add guided learning interface with menu-driven navigation

Transformed application into easy-to-use guided learning system with
interactive menus and automatic progress tracking. Users no longer need
to memorize commands - just type ''linalg-tutor'' and follow the menus!

New Features:

Main Menu System:
- Default command now shows interactive menu instead of help
- Main menu with Continue/Select Chapter/Progress/Practice/Settings
- Chapter selection menu with all 10 topics
- Per-chapter menus with practice/visualizations/solvers options
- Settings menu with reset and data location viewing
- Full keyboard navigation \(arrow keys, enter, Ctrl+C\)

Session State Management:
- Automatic progress saving to ~/.linalg_tutor/data/session_state.json
- Tracks current chapter, completed topics, in-progress topics
- Resume learning from where you left off
- "Continue Learning" option appears when you have progress
- Total exercises and time tracking
- Progress percentage calculation \(chapters completed / 10\)

10-Chapter Learning Path:
1. Vectors → 2. Matrices → 3. Linear Systems → 4. Vector Spaces →
5. Orthogonality → 6. Determinants → 7. Eigenvalues → 8. Transformations →
9. Decompositions → 10. Applications

Chapter progression:
- Automatic advancement to next chapter on completion
- Status indicators: ✓ Complete, ⚡ In Progress, → Current, ○ Not Started
- Recommended chapter based on progress
- Mark topics complete to unlock next content

Per-Chapter Options:
- Practice Curated Exercises \(hand-crafted with hints\)
- Generate Practice Problems \(infinite randomized\)
- View Visualizations \(commands shown\)
- Advanced Solvers \(commands shown\)

User Experience:
- No commands to memorize - everything menu-driven
- Graceful Ctrl+C handling throughout
- Progress automatically saved after each session
- Clean, organized interface with Rich formatting
- Clear status indicators and progress visualization

Backward Compatibility:
- All original commands still work \(exercise, generate, visualize, solve\)
- Expert users can skip menus and use commands directly
- Menu system is optional enhancement, not requirement

Technical Details:
- Session state stored in JSON format
- LearningPath Pydantic model for validation
- SessionState class manages state persistence
- GuidedLearningApp controller for main loop
- MainMenu UI components for display
- Integration with existing ProgressTracker

Testing:
- 20 new automated tests \(12 unit + 8 integration\)
- All 31 existing tests still pass \(no regressions\)
- 51/51 tests passing \(100% success rate\)
- Session state: 90% code coverage
- Progress tracker: 80% code coverage
- Complete user journey tested

Files Created:
- linalg_tutor/core/progress/session_state.py \(195 lines\)
- linalg_tutor/cli/ui/main_menu.py \(278 lines\)
- linalg_tutor/cli/guided_app.py \(403 lines\)
- tests/unit/test_progress/test_session_state.py \(12 tests\)
- tests/integration/test_guided_app.py \(8 tests\)
- GUIDED_LEARNING.md \(complete user guide\)
- TEST_RESULTS_GUIDED_LEARNING.md \(test results\)

Files Modified:
- linalg_tutor/cli/app.py \(callback to launch menu by default\)
- linalg_tutor/core/progress/__init__.py \(export new classes\)

Usage:
Simply type ''linalg-tutor'' and navigate with arrow keys!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Improve exercise UI: compact layout with dynamic sizing

User feedback: Too much wasted space requiring scrolling to see question.

Changes:
- Header: Reduced from 3 lines to 1 compact line
  Format: "Topic │ Exercise 1/5 │ Difficulty"
- Question panel: Changed from fixed 8 lines to dynamic 2-6 lines
  Calculates needed space based on question text length
- Removed extra spacing before menu options
- Hints: Single line breaks instead of double \(more compact\)
- Stats: Inline format without panel borders
  Format: "Attempts: 2 │ Hints: 1/3"
- Panel padding: Reduced to minimal \(0, 1\)
- Terminal size: Lowered minimum from 80×24 to 80×15

Result: Question always visible without scrolling, no wasted space,
cleaner professional appearance.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
